learning_outcomes.description: Critically analyse and integrate information from a wide range of sources
Evaluate opinions, make decisions and to reflect using an evidence-based approach
Formulate and investigate problems, create solutions, innovate and improve current practices
Collect, analyse and organise information and ideas and to convey those ideas clearly and fluently, in both written and spoken forms
Apply critical reasoning to issues through independent thought and informed judgement
Identify clinical questions in your everyday clinical practice, and formulate these into answerable research questions
Develop the skills to critically evaluate a component of your own clinical practice to ensure that practice is supported by recognised quality standards and/or research evidence
Describe and explain the concepts of Evidence Based Medicine and appreciate their relevance to everyday clinical practice

assessments.task_description:
You should choose and review a journal article from the list provided. The chosen article is to be scientifically analysed against your clinical practice background.

A basic draft of the report will be submitted to complete the compliance hurdle. 

1. Identify which journal article you will critique

2. 300-word summary of the Strengths and Limitations of the selected study.

The purpose of the draft is to provide you with the opportunity to receive feedback prior to your final submission.

assessments.assessment_title: Critical appraisal of a scientific paper -  Report
assessments.task_description:
You should choose and review a journal article from the list provided.

They will assess the scientific quality of the article and write a critique of the key features of the manuscript.

The report should critically evaluate key aspects such as the clarity and relevance of study aims, the suitability of the study design, the quality of the background and discussion and study limitations. The report will additionally discuss the clinical relevance of the paper's content to your area of work in clinical skin cancer medicine.

Expected word count is maximum 1500 words.

assessments.task_description: Prepare a 10 minute presentation. Create approximately 10 slides (1 slide per minute as a rough guide) to step through the key findings for of your critical appraisal. Record yourself presenting your appraisal.

assessments.task_description:
Using the knowledge and skills gained from this course as well as earlier courses in the Master program, you will prepare a literature review in an area relevant to skin cancer practice. You will select a topic from the list provided. The purpose of the draft is to provide you with the opportunity to receive feedback prior to your final submission.

1. Identify your topic for review

2. At a minimum, provide dot points for the key elements of the report

3. Include a basic reflection on the relevance to skin cancer practice

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to submit a clinical log via use of the SCARD database. The log requires a minimum of 50 cases. Proper collation and entry of data will make analysis easier.

You will complete an audit of your own patients, including a written analysis (1500 words) comparing your results with those from the broader SCARD database of skin cancer practitioners

The Introduction/rationale must include a description of your clinical practice.

Although a detailed knowledge of statistics is not required, it is expected some basic analytical principles be employed when looking at the data. Analysis of raw data will be complete when accompanied by literature research, contemplation of how these results tabulate with your patient population and medical practice setup.

Details will be made available on the course Learn.UQ site.

assessments.task_description:
Clinical practice is built on a foundation of published knowledge. Reviewing published work is an essential part of professional development. The final assessment is the preparation of a literature review (maximum 2000 words) in an area relevant to skin cancer. You will select a topic from the list provided.

You are to write a structured literature review using the framework provided. Details will be made available on the course Learn.UQ site. At the end of this course, students completing this task should be confident in preparing a journal article and to feel comfortable with the concept of possibly publishing future work.
